list_translation_mean.translate_mean: dây ở khí cầu thả xuống
máy vớt đồ vật bị chìm

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: pull (someone or something) along forcefully, roughly, or with difficulty.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: we dragged the boat up the beach
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Chúng tôi kéo thuyền lên bãi biển

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: (of time, events, or activities) pass slowly and tediously.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: the day dragged—eventually it was time for bed
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Ngày kéo dài - cuối cùng đã đến giờ đi ngủ

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: move (an icon or other image) across a computer screen using a tool such as a mouse.

list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: they were caught dragging on Francis Lewis Blvd
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Họ đã bị bắt được kéo vào Francis Lewis Blvd

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: the action of pulling something forcefully or with difficulty.
a boring or tiresome person or thing.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: working nine to five can be a drag
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Làm việc chín đến năm có thể là một lực cản

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: an act of inhaling smoke from a cigarette.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: he took a long drag on his cigarette
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: Anh kéo một chiếc kéo dài trên điếu thuốc của mình

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: clothing more conventionally worn by the opposite sex, especially women's clothes worn by a man.
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_en: a fashion show, complete with men in drag
list_definition_mean.definitions_ex_vn: một chương trình thời trang, hoàn thành với những người đàn ông đang kéo

list_definition_mean.definitions_word_en: a thing that is pulled along the ground or through water.
a strong-smelling lure drawn before hounds as a substitute for a fox or other hunted animal.
one of the basic patterns (rudiments) of drumming, consisting of a stroke preceded by two grace notes, which are usually played with the other stick.
a private vehicle like a stagecoach, drawn by four horses.
